com.arctro.cachemap

Class CacheMap<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.arctro.cachemap.CacheMap<K,V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - The key type
    V - The value type

    public class CacheMap<K,V>
extends java.lang.Object
    A hashmap that expires values after a defined time. Checks the next 10 keys every millisecond for expired values, although this can be changed with the setDelay(int) function. An expiry time for the entire hashmap can also be set, in which all values will be removed and no new data can be entered.
    Version:
    1.6
    Author:
    Ben McLean

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      CacheMap()
      Create an empty CacheMap with no expiry
      CacheMap(long expire)
      Create a CacheMap with an expiry time

      • stageSize

        public void stageSize(int size)
        Sets the size of the stage when iterating through the keys. For example if stage size is set to 10 the map will check the first 10 keys, then on the next check it will check the next 10 keys, and so on.
        Parameters:
        size - Stage size

      • removeExpired

        public void removeExpired()
        Removes all expired values
